titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Anne Funkhouser Francis graduated from Bryn Mawr College in 1933. She received her master's in German from Bryn Mawr in 1936. She is the author of Hieronimus Bosch: The Temptation of Saint Anthony and Voyage of Re-discovery: The Veneration of Saint Vincent.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of eleven binders of notes and manuscripts for Francis's books on Portuguese art. The binders contain typed manuscripts with photographs, indexes, and references for Voyage of Re-discovery and "Raise High the Monuments." The latter appears to be unpublished. Also included are photographs and text on Manueline art and architecture.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
